intro: Leucadendron inflexum, commonly known as the silver tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and cone-like inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is a member of the Proteaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance and adaptability to poor soils. It thrives in full sun and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance. The silver tree is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
